panels.description:
### Queue duration

The query-scheduler is an optional service that moves the internal queue from the query-frontend into a separate component. If the query-scheduler is deployed, these panels will show "No data."
panels.title: Queue duration

panels.description:
### Queue length

The query-scheduler is an optional service that moves the internal queue from the query-frontend into a separate component. If the query-scheduler is deployed, these panels will show "No data."
panels.title: Queue length (per pod)

panels.description:
### Queue length

The query-scheduler is an optional service that moves the internal queue from the query-frontend into a separate component. If the query-scheduler is deployed, these panels will show "No data."
panels.title: Queue length (per user)

panels.description:
### Queue duration

The query-scheduler is an optional service that moves the internal queue from the query-frontend into a separate component. If the query-scheduler is not deployed, these panels will show "No data."
panels.title: Queue duration

panels.description:
### Queue length

The query-scheduler is an optional service that moves the internal queue from the query-frontend into a separate component. If the query-scheduler is not deployed, these panels will show "No data."
panels.title: Queue length (per pod)

panels.description:
### Queue length

The query-scheduler is an optional service that moves the internal queue from the query-frontend into a separate component. If the query-scheduler is not deployed, these panels will show "No data."
panels.title: Queue length (per user)

panels.description:
### Intervals per query
The average number of split queries (partitioned by time) executed a single input query.
panels.title: Intervals per query

targets.expr:
# Query the new metric introduced in Mimir 2.10.
(
  sum by(request_type) (rate(cortex_frontend_query_result_cache_hits_total{$read_path_matcher}[$__rate_interval]))
  /
  sum by(request_type) (rate(cortex_frontend_query_result_cache_requests_total{$read_path_matcher}[$__rate_interval]))
)
# Otherwise fallback to the previous general-purpose metrics.
or
(
  label_replace(
    sum (
      rate(thanos_cache_hits_total{name="frontend-cache", $read_path_matcher}[$__rate_interval])
    )
    /
    sum (
      rate(thanos_cache_requests_total{name=~"frontend-cache", $read_path_matcher}[$__rate_interval])
    ),
    "request_type", "query_range", "", "")
)

panels.description:
### Query results cache skipped
The % of queries whose results could not be cached.
It is tracked for each split query when the splitting by interval is enabled.
panels.title: Query results cache skipped

rows.title: Query-frontend – query splitting and results cache

panels.description:
### Sharded queries ratio
The % of queries that have been successfully rewritten and executed in a shardable way.
This panel only takes into account the type of queries that are supported by query sharding (eg. range queries).
panels.title: Sharded queries ratio

panels.description:
### Number of sharded queries per query
The number of sharded queries that have been executed for a single input query. It only tracks queries that
have been successfully rewritten in a shardable way.
panels.title: Number of sharded queries per query
Number of store-gateways hit per query
Refetches of missing blocks per query

panels.description:
### Consistency checks failed
Rate of queries that had to run with consistency checks and those checks failed. A failed consistency check means that some of at least one block which had to be queried wasn't present in any of the store-gateways.
panels.title: Consistency checks failed

panels.description:
### Rejected queries
The proportion of all queries received by queriers that were rejected for some reason.
panels.title: Rejected queries

panels.description:
### Estimated per-query memory consumption
The esimated memory consumption of all queries evaluated by queriers. Only applicable if the Mimir query engine (MQE) is enabled and the query was evaluated with MQE.
panels.title: Estimated per-query memory consumption

panels.description:
### Fallback to Prometheus' query engine
The rate of queries that fell back to Prometheus' query engine in queriers. Only applicable if the Mimir query engine (MQE) is enabled.
panels.title: Fallback to Prometheus' query engine

panels.description:
### Blocks queried / sec by compaction level
Increased volume of lower levels (for example levels 1 and 2) can indicate that the compactor is not keeping up.
In that case the store-gateway will start serving more blocks which aren't that well compacted.
panels.title: Blocks queried / sec by compaction level

targets.expr:
sum by(data_type) (
  # Exclude "chunks refetched".
  rate(cortex_bucket_store_series_data_size_fetched_bytes_sum{component="store-gateway", stage!="refetched", cluster=~"$cluster", job=~"($namespace)/((store-gateway.*|cortex|mimir))"}[$__rate_interval])
)

sum by(data_type) (
  # Exclude "chunks processed" to only count "chunks returned", other than postings and series.
  rate(cortex_bucket_store_series_data_size_touched_bytes_sum{component="store-gateway", stage!="processed",cluster=~"$cluster", job=~"($namespace)/((store-gateway.*|cortex|mimir))"}[$__rate_interval])
)

panels.description:
### Series batch preloading efficiency
This panel shows the % of time reduced by preloading, for Series() requests which have been
split to 2+ batches. If a Series() request is served within a single batch, then preloading
is not triggered, and thus not counted in this measurement.

targets.expr:
# Clamping min to 0 because if preloading not useful at all, then the actual value we get is
# slightly negative because of the small overhead introduced by preloading.
clamp_min(1 - (
    sum(rate(cortex_bucket_store_series_batch_preloading_wait_duration_seconds_sum{cluster=~"$cluster", job=~"($namespace)/((store-gateway.*|cortex|mimir))"}[$__rate_interval]))
    /
    sum(rate(cortex_bucket_store_series_batch_preloading_load_duration_seconds_sum{cluster=~"$cluster", job=~"($namespace)/((store-gateway.*|cortex|mimir))"}[$__rate_interval]))
), 0)

panels.title: Series batch preloading efficiency

panels.description:
### Blocks currently owned
This panel shows the number of blocks owned by each store-gateway replica.
For each owned block, the store-gateway keeps its index-header on disk, and
eventually loaded in memory (if index-header lazy loading is disabled, or lazy loading
is enabled and the index-header was loaded).
panels.title: Blocks currently owned

panels.description:
### Index-header lazy load gate latency
Time spent waiting for a turn to load an index header. This time is not included in "Index-header lazy load duration."
panels.title: Index-header lazy load gate latency
Chunks attributes in-memory cache hit ratio

list.description: Choose between showing latencies based on low precision classic or high precision native histogram metrics.
list.label: Latency metrics
list.name: latency_metrics
